articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jordanian police cordoned off an area in the vicinity of the Israeli embassy in the capital Amman after gunshots were heard, witnesses said on Sunday.
articles.title: Jordanian police cordon off area near Israeli embassy after gunshots heard, witnesses say

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Emily Rose
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faces legal perils at home and abroad that point to a turbulent future for the Israeli leader and could influence the wars in Gaza and Lebanon, analysts and officials say.
articles.title: Legal threats close in on Israel's Netanyahu, could impact ongoing wars

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan's capital was put under a security lockdown on Sunday ahead of protests by supporters of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan calling for his release.
articles.title: Islamabad locked down ahead of protests seeking ex-PM Imran Khan's release

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Voters in South America's laid-back Uruguay, known for its beaches, legalized marijuana and stability, will head to the polls on Sunday in a second-round presidential race between moderates that closes out a bumper year of elections.
articles.title: Uruguay votes for next president in closely fought runoff race

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Romanians vote on Sunday in the first round of a presidential election that may give a shot at victory to hard-right politician George Simion, who opposes military aid to Ukraine, admires Donald Trump and wants to emulate Giorgia Meloni's Italy.
articles.title: Hard right's Simion in with a chance as Romanians vote for president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has removed a senior general in Ukraine for giving misleading reports about the progress of the war as Defence Minister Andrei Belousov tries to clear out poor commanders, pro-Russian war bloggers and Russian media said.
articles.title: Russia removes commander in Ukraine for misleading reports, war bloggers say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Lao government is "profoundly saddened" by the deaths of foreign tourists from drinking alcohol contaminated with methanol and pledged to prosecute those responsible.
articles.title: Laos vows justice after tainted alcohol kills tourists

articles.author: Colleen Howe
articles.description: Local authorities in China are stepping up safety management and police patrols following several high-profile mass killings, as the central government calls for enhanced public security, media reports said on Sunday.
articles.title: China's local governments step up public safety measures after attacks
Russia says US using Taiwan to stir crisis in Asia

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military issued new evacuation orders to residents in areas of an eastern Gaza City suburb, setting off a new wave of displacement on Sunday, and a Gaza hospital director was injured in an Israeli drone attack, Palestinian medics said.
articles.title: Israeli army orders Gaza City suburb evacuated, spurring new displacement wave
